messages.message: Hi there! I know you will not be inclined to trust me but I am not a fan of attacking Austria immediately as Italy. As such I hope we can work together. I’ll be playing pretty safe until I have a grasp of the board. Have you heard from anyone yet?
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Hi there! I know you will not be inclined to trust me but I am not a fan of attacking Austria immediately as Italy. As such I hope we can work together. I’ll be playing pretty safe until I have a grasp of the board. Have you heard from anyone yet?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's initial message expressing a preference for cooperation with Austria and a cautious approach aligns well with a diplomatic attitude seeking to establish a peaceful relationship. The mention of playing safe and seeking communication indicates a genuine interest in working together and understanding the current diplomatic landscape.

messages.message: Hello Italy.  I would be fine with being friendly.  How would you suggest we prove said friendliness to each other?  I am on the late side of messaging so I have received a few messages.

messages.message: I am open to your ideas.  If we sit forever we are just wasting a units movement
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'I am open to your ideas.  If we sit forever we are just wasting a units movement'.

messages.message: I need my build this season, so vacating Ven and trusting you to not take it is too big of a risk for me. Right now you could stab me without any consequence to yourself, so I have to view me having Ven as a protection against that. You may have a different opinion, but I don’t see you as being in the same boat. Even if you vacate Tri and I take it (which I won’t) you would still get a build and I would end up being stuck fighting you without much momentum. So I propose that you move out of Tri first and when I see that you can’t take Ven, then I will move out of Ven.
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'I need my build this season, so vacating Ven and trusting you to not take it is too big of a risk for me. Right now you could stab me without any consequence to yourself, so I have to view me having Ven as a protection against that. You may have a different opinion, but I don’t see you as being in the same boat. Even if you vacate Tri and I take it (which I won’t) you would still get a build and I would end up being stuck fighting you without much momentum. So I propose that you move out of Tri first and when I see that you can’t take Ven, then I will move out of Ven.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's proposal for a sequential move strategy regarding Venice and Trieste displays a clear rationale and diplomatic caution, emphasizing the importance of trust building to avoid misunderstandings and potential conflicts. This approach indicates a thoughtful and strategic mindset aimed at maintaining a stable and cooperative relationship with Austria.
